description.narrative: Polluted water is a more serious problem to health than many of the pests that get attention in newsmedia. Virus-infected water cause problems in the GI-tract and causes of many deaths annually. Treatment of water in order to remove viruses is a challenge. There is a need for inexpensive and efficient methods. This application deals with chromatographic filter-technology to capture virus particles and then destruct them using enzymatic hydrolysis. Capture is mediated via selective receptors that are developed using phage display technology. The whole concept is a transformation of the high resolving technology used in pharameutical industri, now adapted to wastewater handling. Thus, a robust and inexpensive technology. The new features are a supermacroporous hydrogel placed in protective housing and derivatised with inexpensive receptors produced via phage display and chromatopanning.
